def repeats(arr):
    return sum([x for x in arr if arr.count(x) == 1])

def repeats(arr):
    return sum(n for n in arr if arr.count(n) == 1)

def repeats(arr):
  single = [] #create a list to store single numbers
  for i in arr: #loop thru the array
    if arr.count(i) == 1: #if a number occurs more than once in the array
        single.append(i) #attach it to the singles list
  total = sum (single) 
  return total

def repeats(arr):
    
    
    return sum(filter(lambda num : arr.count(num) == 1, arr))

def repeats(arr):
    return sum(num for num in arr if arr.count(num) == 1)

def repeats(a):
    return sum(filter(lambda x: a.count(x) < 2, a))

def repeats(arr):
    return sum(i for i in arr if arr.count(i) == 1)
